comment: Took a 4-week summer course, one page paper due every week then 4 page essay at the end of the 4 weeks. As long as you do not forget to turn in the material it's an easy A

Outside of the long readings, I really enjoyed this class and highly recommend. He gives great feedbacks. The only reason why I got a C was because of my own doing, I missed a quiz and my midterm. The class consisted of 7 quizzes, 14 100 worded discussions, and 3 major assignments (a midterm, final essay exam folder, and a 8-10 analytical paper).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I enjoyed the class but it's a pretty heavy workload at times. There was a group project and presentation, just be careful about who you partner up with for it. The lectures can be a little slow but he's engaging and very kind. I really liked the topics he chose to focus on. Attending is definitely necessary to fill out the notes for exams.
If you wanna write an 8-12 page essay for no reason take him. Has ridiculous requirements, very ubhelpful teacher. I did not like.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: I don't recommend him as a teacher. The class itself is pretty easy the only thing is his lectures are not fun nor encouraging. If you miss his class more than 4 times 5% of your grade will be taken off, which I think its absurd. He also has a supper heavy African accent which personally made it hard for me to understand.

Took this professor for a 4-week summer course. The content was informative and I was able to gain a lot of knowledge that related to everyday life. He is a bit tough on grading and some quiz questions can be tricky. Don't be discouraged thought since he does give you a lot of constructive criticism on how to improve for the next assignment.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: The "lectures" or PowerPoints this professor uploads are incomplete and not specific facts at all. There are few grades in the class, he is a tough grader, and don't bother trying to reach him at all, he will never respond. He is also quite rude with his feedback on assignments. He's not a teacher, just a grader. Choose someone else to TEACH you.

Dr. Sam Abaidoo is a very knowledgeable professor who provided helpful feedback on each and every feedback. His assignments require a lot but welcome to a 3000-level course lol. If you do your assignments on time, study all materials, and email him for clarification you'll be just fine! I finished this course in the summer (8 weeks) with an A.

You can tell he is knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. Did not require a textbook. I have enjoyed both in person and online courses of his. Course consists of discussion boards and quizzes. Midterm and final are short essay format along with one essay. He gives detailed feedback on each assignment which is greatly appreciated.

Professor Abaidoo isn't a bad professor and my grade in this class was my own doing. If I had actually put in the effort, I would have had an A in that class. He is quite lecture heavy and you have to do a good bit of research and learning on your own. However, there are very few assignments for this class which is nice. Good professor, bad class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly, I really enjoyed his class, out of the four classes I was taking, he was the easiest. I also don't feel like he was that harsh of a grader. His class was breeze as long as you do the assignments you'll pass. He also gave good feedback which helped a lot. I would definitely take him again.

Professor Abaidoo's class is pretty straight forward. 10 DQs, 10 Quizzes, min. 8 pg. research Paper, NO TESTS, and 1 midterm and final. The MT and Final are just short essays with 4 topics to pick out of the ones he provides, put in the work, and take it seriously. He ISN'T the easiest grader on them. Stay on top of your assignments and Good LUCK!

Is not available to assist if you have questions or need clarity, doesn't show a concern towards students understanding or not, even when you tell him that you don't. it's like knock knock, who's there? NO ONE This is a very important class. Please take another professor.

I learned so much in this class and I am grateful for that! However, the professor made this unnecessarily tedious. The weekly synopsis assignment is not well represented in D2L and he did not tell any of us that we were not completing them for WEEKS. The workload is really a lot especially when working full-time. Took up 90% of my study time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Abaidoo was such an amazing professor! He has plenty of stories and the lectures are very intriguing. We had a midterm (essay questions), a paper, and discussions online. Attendance is mandatory; you will take a major deduction if you miss 4 classes or more. Please take Dr. Abaidoo!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took race and ethnicity. Prof knows his stuff when it comes to lectures. You have a short answer midterm where he gives you 16 questions and you pick 5. Then rest of the class is group presentations over a chapter of the book. He takes roll every class. Overall he grades kinda tough but its not bad. There is a paper too!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Make sure you keep up with the readings and are thorough in answering his questions on the tests. There are 2 essay question tests, short quiz, and discussion posts. Good teacher!
He does not have any exams. Grades are based off papers and attendance and participation, as well as group-led discussions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters
